attributes.action: Gloucester council to change recycling boxes and bags to a bin.
attributes.additional_details:
Tewksbury council use a blue bin that all the recycling going into, much more room and less likely to blow away in the wind.
I have watched Gloucester council recycling go into the same compartment of the lorry so why do we separate the different recycling? 
If you buy a tv or a fridge there is no chance of folding the cardboard into the blue bag. 
If recycling is easy everyone will do it, so make it easy and just have one bin for it all to go into.
attributes.background: Recycling boxes and bags are useless, the lids provided are flimsy and if you have lots of recycling you can’t put them on. The boxes are left on the side of the road and when windy rubbish gets blown everywhere. The bags for cardboard are tiny and won’t hold much. Let’s just have a bin.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local waste and recycling services are the responsibility of the relevant local authority.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
